subject: Physical Fitness
title: Lower Back Pain in Fitness
description: One-minute skill: Lower Back Pain in Fitness.

hook.text: Eighty percent of people will experience lower back pain. It's the world's leading cause of disability.

buildup.text: In fitness settings, back pain often follows deadlifts, squats, or sudden movements with poor bracing.

discovery.text: Most lower back pain isn't from structural damage. It's from muscle spasm, poor load management, or deconditioning.

twist.text: Imaging often shows disc bulges in people with zero pain. Structural findings don't predict who hurts.

climax.text: Gradual loading, core stability, and hip mobility prevent most fitness-related back pain episodes.

punchline.text: Back pain is common but rarely dangerous. Movement is usually the best medicine.
